text.section:
Within 30 days after the Commissioner denies an application, the Commissioner shall:
File in the Commissioner's office a written decision containing the findings and conclusions on which the denial was based;
Send a copy of the decision to the applicant; and
Advise the applicant by certified mail of the applicant's right to a hearing to be held in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act.

section.section: An applicant who seeks a hearing on a license application denial shall file a written request for a hearing within 45 days following receipt of the advice to the applicant of the applicant's right to a hearing.
A hearing date established in response to the filing of a notice under this subsection may be postponed only once for a period of up to 30 days after the initial hearing date.
